medical_history.chief_complaint: Refractory, symptomatic epilepsy including frequent gelastic and complex partial seizures.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 3 months of age and include frequent gelastic seizures (3–50 times per day) as well as infrequent generalized tonic–clonic and drop seizures. Seizures have poorly controlled on three antiepileptic drugs and previously failed to respond to five others.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of mental retardation, behavioral problems, panhypopituitarism, precocious puberty, imperforate anus, and polydactyly.
medical_history.family_history: Younger brother also has Pallister–Hall syndrome and hypothalamic hamartoma, with no phenotypic features observed in the parents.
